Award.AwardTitle: EAGER: Utilization of Recycled Concrete in New Building Construction
Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this collaborative US-Turkish pilot research project is to investigate the use of Recycled Concrete Aggregate (RCA) obtained from demolition waste as a substitute for natural aggregate (NA) for the production of new concrete. The topic has been studied for many decades; however, very little progress has been made toward the widespread use of RCA in good-quality concrete for new structures. The research team is uniquely qualified to conduct the bilateral cooperative research and consists of experts in Recycled Concrete Construction Materials at CUNY City College (CCNY) and Structural Engineering at Istanbul Technical University (ITU). Experimental facilities needed to study materials at the micro-scale are at CCNY while facilities for full-scale macro-scale structural testing are at ITU.

This project brings together researchers from the US and Turkey and will include reciprocal visits by the two US and two Turkish PIs to each other's laboratories as well as a three month graduate student exchange during the 12 month project. This close working environment will expose individuals in both teams to very different cultural and scientific environments and foster closer relations between US and Turkish researchers. CCNY is a Minority Serving Institution (and Hispanic Serving Institution) and the exposure of STEM students at CCNY to researchers from Turkey and vice versa will be immensely valuable to promoting cultural understanding in two of the world's greatest cities. Also both New York City and Istanbul have unique urban infrastructure construction markets. Working with recycled concrete aggregate producers and manufacturers of structural concrete (Ready Mix companies or batching facilities at construction sites) in these two markets will provide a unique opportunity to develop solutions across a wide spectrum of real-life conditions and constraints.

Institution.Name: CUNY City College
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK

ProgramReference.Text: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

POR.DRECONTENT:
Experimental investigations were performed on coarse recycled concrete aggregate (RCA) and concrete incorporating RCA. Tests of mechanical performance at material and structural levels were performed. Tests for measuring indicators of durability were performed on RCA and RCA-incorporated concert. The variation in the quality of RCA produced in one concrete plant over a period of three months was studied.

Full replacement of natural coarse aggregate (NA) with high quality well-graded RCA in concrete resulted in a significant reduction in compressive strength. However, the effect of aggregate type on the flexural strength of reinforced concrete beams was negligible. An external shear strengthening system using fiber reinforced polymer (FRP) composite fabrics was developed for reinforced concrete beams. When the system is used shear load carrying capacity of the beams made with the weaker RCA concrete is higher than that of NA concrete beams. 10 samples of RCA from different production batches of a New York recycling plant were collected over a period of three months. A number of durability and mechanical performance tests were performed on the RCA specimens and concrete incorporating the RCAs. The results showed a low variation in all the results. All the measured durability indicator values were below the limits specified or recommended by codes and guidelines.

 


Last Modified: 12/05/2016
Modified by: Ardavan Yazdanbakhsh
